website_summaries.verdict: A clear dial thermometer for the oven that can also be used on the grill.
pros: Can be mounted two different ways
cons: Some owners complain that it takes too long to come to temperature

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to check accuracy of the oven in a new apartment and bought it on recommendation of a cooking site. Put it alongside old thermometer and it only worked on and off since it arrived. Kept thinking it was the old thermometer that was off. Now the CDN needle does not move at all until you've given it a good shake. You can hear something rattling. Sadly, I am beyond 30 day return date so I am out $13. Leads me to think the cooking site is on the take.
customer_reviews.author: beachless

customer_reviews.title: CDN Oven Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Though this product was rated as "the best" in an equipment test by a reputable baking site, the thermometer took 30 min to register 350 deg. My old thermometer indicated the 350 deg mark in 10 minutes. Definitely not an "instant read" devise. It was not any easier to read than the old thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Judy F.

customer_reviews.title: Certified? Very inaccurate!!
customer_reviews.text: Highly inaccurate right out of the box! Certified? More than 75 degrees off!!! Don’t waste your $. Finally used this outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Luvflying

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer reads low and no return
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer was reading low by 20 degrees when compared to the oven and two other digital thermometers. The product is not eligible for return. Rather disappointed
customer_reviews.author: eatox

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have two brand new ovens and bought this thermometer to calibrate the temperatures. I set both ovens to 350 degrees and kept them at that temperature about 20 minutes. The thermometer registered 300 degrees in one oven and about 305 degrees in the second oven. I jiggled the thermometer after removing from the second oven and the needle jumped up about 10 degrees. So, it's basically useless for calibrating.
customer_reviews.author: JaySlm

customer_reviews.title: It only confuses.
customer_reviews.text: This thing won the best on America's Test Kitchen. Either it's whacked or my oven is. Before I got it I baked without a single issue. Now this reads I'm so far off I don't know where to begin. Wish I never bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B pvvcccvc?w2w

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Ordered twice and checked each item with two master thermometers. Product produced lower temperature both times ( 14 degrees and 25 degrees). Baking temperatures were totally inaccurate both times.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. ET

customer_reviews.title: bing!!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it was good but the second time I heard Bing!! and it was broken I will get another one because it might have been my fault. I put it on top f a pizza stone and that might have made it too hot so until I get another one I reserve judgement.
customer_reviews.author: David M Rich

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, by reviews.
customer_reviews.text: No major complaints, though would have liked a slightly larger face for easier readout. Main feature is the accuracy which is hard to assess without testing against a standard. Reviews suggest that this product is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald R

customer_reviews.title: Great thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I read about this particular oven thermometer in Avery reputable magazine and decided to try it. It’s working great! You have 3 choices of how to put it in your oven: hang by hook, clip on rack, or stand alone.
customer_reviews.author: patricia z. choo

customer_reviews.title: If you could only read it
customer_reviews.text: The silver looks good sitting on the counter but when in the oven it was impossible to see the needle or the numbers against the silver background when viewing through the oven window.
customer_reviews.author: kingp

customer_reviews.title: Oven accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Tried to test oven temp. unable to get thermometer to = oven temp. Had repaired and ovens are equal but themometer was not
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This oven thermometer works well, is easy to read and did not cost an arm and leg. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: DHBRef

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, get one.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate, hangs easily from top rack. Let me know my stove runs too cool.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t stay standing in oven even when not being moved. Temperature measurement inaccurate by 25-50 degrees as tested.
customer_reviews.author: MaryH

customer_reviews.title: this is a dependable thermometer
customer_reviews.text: durable and long lasting also very accurate which is important
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mcdade

customer_reviews.title: Accurate oven thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Accurate. I placed this with another brand and they both registered the same. My oven is off and wanted to double check by how much.
customer_reviews.author: amazonlover

customer_reviews.title: Use tongs to remove it from the oven after checking it
customer_reviews.text: No longer trusted my old oven, so I needed to check out temperature before a holiday party. Sure enough, just as I expected, my old oven is running 50 degrees less than the setting. Used this also to check my two electric roasters and they were spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Does what’s it’s designed to do
customer_reviews.text: Solid duty oven thermometer. Sits or hangs nicely on a rack.
customer_reviews.author: GR4

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk! Set oven at 390, it read 200. Baking showed that oven thermometer was closer to right.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bavier

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I like that it can either hang or sit on shelf. Found out my oven is off by about 50 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is east to read. It does not take up much room in oven. It is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quickly check your oven temperature
customer_reviews.text: I like the large display - quick glance to see the oven temp. Also, I like that I can hang it or have it sit on the oven rack.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Rainwater

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: See the photos; one with the oven set to 375-deg F, and the other with the oven set to 475-deg F. Who would have figured the cheap Rubbermaid oven thermometer would have been the most accurate and responsive device? The "CDN DOT2 ProAccurate Oven Thermometer, The Best Oven Thermometer for Instant Read in Food Cooking" is worthless. Neither of the ones I purchased were accurate, not even close. One would bind as the needle moved up the dial. One took 15 to 20 minutes to stabilize at 375 deg. -- neither was even close to the "Instant Read" claim. Both are being returned for a refund. Obviously there was no quality control involved in the manufacture of these thermometers.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it was rated as good. I have three oven thermometers, none of them is truly the best. This one has a difficult time with accuracy over 350 degrees. So good for checking for preheating an oven to 350, if I am baking over that temp, not much use. Also both foot and hanger are about 90 degrees off to be able to read it in the oven, they do not align with the racks so it must sit loose in the oven and not hung from the rack.
customer_reviews.author: D Zattau

customer_reviews.title: Fooled again by Cook illustrated, 350 is the 300 on this CDN.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something for my outdoor smoker, you know reasonably priced. Placed this in my JennAir at 350. CDN reads 300. Check oven with there open digital and some of the other digital thermometers. They all agree oven is 350F +/- 5. The CDN reads 300...
customer_reviews.author: jjnbos

customer_reviews.title: Bad one of the Lot
customer_reviews.text: This particular Thermometer read approximately 50* F lower than actual (verified with digital thermometer, 2nd analog thermometer, and oven readout. I know these are supposed to be accurate but you do get a weak on occasionally I guess. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Blayne Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Not Even Close To Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This unit is 50 degrees off as I found out after having a service call on our new range. Their high end tool that measured to a tenth of degree had me apologizing for making a service call. I have thrown it away.
customer_reviews.author: Buystoomuch

customer_reviews.title: I saw this recommended on American Test Kitchen and it performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I saw this recommended on American Test Kitchen and it performs as advertised. Clearly readable in the oven and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Grams

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT go over 350 no matter what the oven is set at!
customer_reviews.text: I do not like leaving low reviews. None-the-less, please believe all the low reviews. I have 2 other thermometers and no matter what my oven is set at, even 425 this item will NOT go over 350! Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: GDS

customer_reviews.title: Saw this product on PBS cooking show, was rated ...
customer_reviews.text: Saw this product on PBS cooking show, was rated as the one to buy. I am not disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Vincent M.

customer_reviews.title: Non Functional
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived non functional. The dial does move when I put it in the oven, but it's so far off, it's laughable.
customer_reviews.author: T. Zawlocki

customer_reviews.title: It falls over easy too.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but hard to see when it is in the oven. It falls over easy too.
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN

customer_reviews.title: Great oven thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this oven thermometer. Relieved concerns that my oven might not be accurate. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CP123

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read
customer_reviews.text: I like that is really does stand up well and has lots of placement options. Seems to be accurate. Don't like that the recessed numbers make it hard to read from top angle.
customer_reviews.author: SashaSS

customer_reviews.title: Still bit sore if the temp in my oven.
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to read as there is no easy way to pick it up when it's hot and my eyesight is failing.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I was able to finally calibrate my oven temperature correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Tbro

customer_reviews.title: Didn't receive item displayed.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I received a lower quality, less expensive, older version. I returned it without opening.
customer_reviews.author: JBK

customer_reviews.title: DOES not work.
customer_reviews.text: This a terrible oven thermometer. Do not buy it. I bought a brand new $00.00 Breville counter top Countertop Oven with Air. The over reached preheat & finished the entire cooking cycle and the thermometer never reached the cook temperature. It was off by 100 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time. It's junk.
customer_reviews.text: Thermometer never worked upon arrival. Tried to use it to calibrate my two ovens. The needle never moved from the six o'clock position. Sorry, America's Test Kitchen. This item is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Simply never worked. Costs more in time and shipping expense to return than product is worth.
customer_reviews.author: Shiongm

product_meta.title: CDN DOT2 ProAccurate Oven Thermometer, The Best Oven Thermometer for Instant Read in Food Cooking. Stainless Steel For Monitoring Oven Temperatures. Large Dial. NSF Certified.
feature_bullets: ✔ ACCURACY: CDN’s ProAccurate Oven Thermometer (DOT2) is specially designed to measure oven temperatures with precise accuracy, ensuring best culinary results. NSF Certified. Measurement Range: 150 to 550°F/70 to 280°C. Easy-to-read dial and display
✔ THE BEST: For best results with your oven, use the DOT2 to monitor the exact oven temperature. Temperature can be sampled from different parts of the oven to check for hot and cool spots.

✔ DURABLE: Made from durable stainless steel with 2-way mounting and a durable laboratory glass lens that resists cracking and breaking, this NSF Certified oven thermometer has a wide temperature range of 150 to 550 F/70 to 280 C.
✔ QUALITY: CDN takes extra steps to ensure quality, durability and accuracy. The company uses 304-grade stainless steel, superior to the stainless steel used in this thermometer.

✔ USEFUL TIP: Set thermometer in oven during the preheat cycle to allow the coil to expand & contract as the oven heats/cools for more accurate reading. From meats to chocolate, the oven or the freezer, whatever you need a temperature reading on.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars108 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
